The authors characterized adverse skin, hair, and nail events in a 27 systematic review of 94 articles, analyzing 689 events. The top 3 most common adverse events 28 were drug eruption or rash (358 cases), cutaneous hyperpigmentation (116 cases), and pruritus 29 (62 cases). There were only 3 cases of hydroxychloroquine-associated nail adverse events.
